skill.name: skill-writer
skill.description: Guide users through creating Agent Skills for Claude Code. Use when the user wants to create, write, author, or design a new Skill, or needs help with SKILL.md files, frontmatter, or skill structure.
skill.summary: Guide users through creating Agent Skills for Claude Code with best practices for structure, frontmatter, and validation.
skill.author: Dami-Randle

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The skill contains only documentation and guidance for creating Claude Code Skills. Scanner flagged YAML frontmatter delimiters (---) as cryptographic patterns and documentation shell examples as executable commands. No actual executable code, network calls, or file operations exist in this skill.

content.value_statement: Users often struggle to create well-structured Agent Skills that follow best practices. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for creating, validating, and testing Claude Code Skills with proper structure, frontmatter, and documentation.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through creating new Agent Skills from scratch
Write proper SKILL.md files with valid YAML frontmatter
Explain skill structure including multi-file layouts
Provide best practices for skill descriptions and activation
Help validate skills against marketplace requirements
Debug skill discovery and activation issues
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly
Cannot create skills in user directories without explicit permission
Does not provide implementation code for skill functionality
Focused on skill structure and documentation, not runtime behavior

use_cases.title: First-time Skill Author
use_cases.description: A user who wants to create their first Agent Skill but does not know the required file structure, frontmatter format, or best practices for descriptions.
use_cases.target_user: New Claude Code users wanting to extend functionality

use_cases.title: Team Skill Developer
use_cases.description: A developer creating shared skills for their team, needing guidance on project-level skill locations, git integration, and collaborative conventions.
use_cases.target_user: Development teams building internal skill libraries

use_cases.title: Skill Debugger
use_cases.description: A user whose skill is not activating or being discovered, needing help troubleshooting YAML syntax, file paths, and description trigger words.

prompt_templates.title: Create a Simple Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new Agent Skill called [skill-name] that [what it does]. Use when [when to use it].

prompt_templates.title: Create a Skill with Tools
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a read-only Agent Skill that only uses Read and Grep tools. The skill should [description].
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a skill with restricted tool permissions

prompt_templates.title: Debug Skill Activation
prompt_templates.prompt: I created a skill but Claude is not using it. My SKILL.md file is at [path]. The description is: [description]. Why is it not activating?

prompt_templates.title: Convert Workflow to Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this workflow into a Claude Code Skill: [describe workflow steps]. Include proper SKILL.md structure with frontmatter, instructions, and examples.
prompt_templates.scenario: Transforming existing workflows into reusable skills

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for extracting text from PDFs
output: Let me help you create a PDF text extraction skill.
- What the skill does: Extract text and tables from PDF files
- When to use it: When working with PDF files
Create a file with YAML frontmatter...
I will create the complete SKILL.md file with proper structure.

output_examples.input: My skill is not being discovered by Claude
output: Let me check common issues with skill activation.
4. Directory name does not match skill name
Please share your SKILL.md frontmatter and description so I can help identify the issue.

best_practices: Keep skills focused on a single capability to improve discovery and reduce conflicts
Include specific trigger words and file types in descriptions to improve activation
Use YAML frontmatter with clear name and description fields under 1024 characters
Test skill activation by asking questions that match the description verbatim
anti_patterns: Creating mega-skills that try to do too many unrelated things
Using vague descriptions like 'helps with documents' or 'analyzes data'
Putting executable scripts in SKILL.md without proper sandboxing
Skipping the testing step and assuming the skill works without verification

faq.question: What is the difference between personal skills and project skills?
faq.answer: Personal skills go in ~/.claude/skills/ and stay on your machine. Project skills go in .claude/skills/ and can be committed to git for team sharing. Both work the same way once loaded.

faq.question: How do I restrict which tools my skill can use?
faq.answer: Add the allowed-tools field to your frontmatter: allowed-tools: Read, Grep, Glob. This creates a read-only skill that cannot modify files.

faq.question: Why is my skill not activating on my queries?
faq.answer: Common causes include: description too generic, missing trigger words, frontmatter YAML errors, or file path incorrect. Add specific phrases users would say and test with exact wording.

faq.question: Can I have multi-file skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Use SKILL.md for the main content, reference.md for advanced options, examples.md for extended use cases, and scripts/ or templates/ directories for supporting files.

faq.question: What characters are allowed in skill names?
faq.answer: Skill names must be lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens only. Maximum 64 characters. The name must match the directory name exactly.

faq.question: Do I need to restart Claude Code after creating a new skill?
faq.answer: Yes. Restart Claude Code to load new or updated skills. Personal skills in ~/.claude/skills/ are loaded on startup. Project skills may require a restart.
